volume.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the amount of sound produced by a television, radio etc
volume.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Can you turn the volume up?
volume.translation[0].definitions[0].not: In everyday English, people usually say turn  something up or turn something down rather than use the noun volume:
Can you turn the TV up a bit?
She’s always yelling at us to turn our music down.
volume.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the total amount of something, especially when it is large or increasing
volume.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The volume of traffic on the roads has increased dramatically in recent years.
volume.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a measurement of the amount of space that a substance or object fills, or the amount of space in a container
volume.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The volume of the container measures 10,000 cubic metres.
an instrument for measuring the volume of a gas
volume.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a book that is part of a set, or one into which a very long book is divided
volume.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The period from 1940–45 is in volume 9.
volume.translation[0].definitions[5].def: all the copies of a particular magazine printed in one particular year
volume.translation[1].definitions[0].def: the amount of space that a substance or object contains or fills
volume.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The US gallon is about five-sixths the volume of the UK gallon.
volume.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The volume of exports was up 4% on the previous 4 months.
the high volume of traffic at O'Hare airport
59% of companies reported that sales volume was lower than a year ago.
The telephone company began offering a new volume discount (=price reduction for using a large amount of goods or services) for business customers.
volume.translation[1].definitions[2].def: the total amount of activity on a stockmarket, usually measured by the number of shares that have been traded in a particular period of time
volume.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: Volume dropped sharply to 113.5 million shares.
